list.name: Changes
list.comment:
[PATCH] refactor: Add README for Project Setup, CSV Download, and API Documentation
- Added a comprehensive `README.md` file with instructions for developers to set up the project locally. - Provided steps on installing Docker, using Laravel Sail, and running migrations and seeders. - Included instructions for the sales team to download CSV files either through the web interface or API. - Updated `.env.example` to reflect changes in the app name and session driver configuration. - Mentioned that all API endpoints are documented in the `openapi.yaml` file.

task.summary:
feat: Add Product model, migration, and seeder
- Create Product model with fillable attributes - Add migration for products table with name and price columns - Implement ProductSeeder with initial product data - Remove default DatabaseSeeder
This commit sets up the basic structure for handling products in the application, including database schema and sample data for testing and development.

feat: Add Basket model and migration
- Create Basket model with fillable attributes for session_id, items, and removed_items - Add migration for baskets table with corresponding columns - Set up JSON casting for items and removed_items in the Basket model
This commit introduces the Basket functionality to the application, allowing for the storage and management of user shopping baskets. It includes the database schema and model structure necessary for handling basket data.

feat: Implement Basket functionality with API and tests
- Add BasketController with CRUD operations for basket items - Create BasketRequest for request validation - Implement feature tests for basket operations (BasketTest) - Set up API routes for basket functionality - Add ProductFactory for testing purposes - Remove example tests - Install and configure Laravel Sanctum for API authentication - Update composer dependencies
This commit introduces the core Basket functionality to the application, including the ability to add items to a basket, remove items, and view removed items. It also sets up the necessary API routes and includes comprehensive feature tests to ensure the reliability of the basket operations.

feat: Implement CSV export for removed basket items with tests
- Add CsvExportService for generating CSV files for removed basket items. - Implement RemovedItemsFetcher to retrieve basket items removed before checkout. - Create feature tests (SalesCsvTest) to verify CSV download functionality. - Add route to download removed items as CSV, supporting optional date range filters. - Update BasketController to include CSV export functionality. - Add user_id to baskets table with corresponding migration. - Improve test structure by refactoring repetitive logic into helper methods. - Ensure SOLID principles are applied across the new services and controllers.
This commit introduces the ability to export removed basket items in CSV format, including filtering by date range, and adds feature tests to ensure this functionality works correctly.

feat: Implement CSV export for removed basket items with tests
- Added CsvExportService for generating CSV files for removed basket items. - Implemented RemovedItemsFetcher to retrieve basket items removed from users' baskets. - Created feature tests to verify the CSV download functionality (SalesCsvTest). - Added routes for downloading removed items as CSV with optional date filters. - Updated BasketController to handle basket items and removed items per user_id. - Refactored basket API routes to handle user-specific basket operations. - Updated BasketTest for user-specific basket and product management. - Dropped session_id field from baskets table, linking baskets directly to user_id. - Added user_id to removed items in the response for clarity in test assertions. - Applied SOLID principles in structuring services and controllers.

[PATCH] refactor: Implement Global Error Handling, Custom Validation, Logging, and API Versioning
- Add global error handling via a custom exception handler. - Use FormRequest classes for validation with custom error messages. - Implement detailed logging for debugging and error tracking. - Refactor API responses to follow standard JSON error responses for common cases. - Ensure appropriate HTTP status codes for validation errors, missing resources, etc. - Update API to follow `v1` versioning with plural endpoint naming. - Add a loading indicator to the frontend to improve user experience during async requests.
Changes: - Updated API routes in `routes/api.php` to use `/v1` and plural naming. - Modified the views to match updated API versioning and to include a loading indicator. - Updated `BasketTest` and `SalesCsvTest` tests to reflect API versioning changes. - Updated `openapi.yaml` to document the new endpoints and structure. - Refactored `Handler.php` for better global error handling and response structure.

[PATCH] refactor: Implement Global Error Handling, Custom Validation, Logging, and API Versioning
- Add global error handling via a custom exception handler. - Use FormRequest classes for validation with custom error messages. - Implement detailed logging for debugging and error tracking. - Refactor API responses to follow standard JSON error responses for common cases. - Ensure appropriate HTTP status codes for validation errors, missing resources, etc. - Update API to follow `v1` versioning with plural endpoint naming. - Add a loading indicator to the frontend to improve user experience during async requests.
Changes: - Updated API routes in `routes/api.php` to use `/v1` and plural naming. - Modified the views to match updated API versioning and to include a loading indicator. - Updated `BasketTest` and `SalesCsvTest` tests to reflect API versioning changes. - Updated `openapi.yaml` to document the new endpoints and structure. - Refactored `Handler.php` for better global error handling and response structure.

[PATCH] refactor: Add README for Project Setup, CSV Download, and API Documentation
- Added a comprehensive `README.md` file with instructions for developers to set up the project locally. - Provided steps on installing Docker, using Laravel Sail, and running migrations and seeders. - Included instructions for the sales team to download CSV files either through the web interface or API. - Updated `.env.example` to reflect changes in the app name and session driver configuration. - Mentioned that all API endpoints are documented in the `openapi.yaml` file.
